item.title: Text Cleaning
item.description: This is my post to show the worst games of the college football season in terms of score differential library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.5 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.1.4 ✓ dplyr 1.0.7 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.3 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 2.0.1 ✓ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() football <- read_csv("badfootballlogs19.

item.title: Why Ndamukong Suh should have won the 2009 Heisman Trophy
item.description: The 2009 college football season was one that had a lot of surprises. Alabama stomped Texas at the Rose Bowl to claim another national championship, the 2009 Fiesta Bowl featured two Group of 5 teams, Boise State and TCU. But one of the biggest surprises from this season was the Heisman Trophy race. Mark Ingram ended up taking home the award, but it left many people confused as they thought it was supposed to go to the best college football player.

item.title: Sports Data 101
item.description: My name is Hayes Oswald and I am a student at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am creating this blog for my SPMC 350 class to show data visualizations.
